results.title: Invisible armour
results.brief_description: The story of a Canadian community which mobilized the energy of all its citizens to protect the health of its children against the common threat of diphtheria. We see how all groups contribute to the success of an immunization campaign. High-school children act as publicists, churches and schools place the issue before parents, a volunteer registration committee makes a door-to-door survey, and as winter weather slows the progress of the drive, service clubs provide “toxoid taxis.” From the awareness of one or two, the community is stirred to act for the good of all.

results.title: Investment planning
results.creator_credit: David Hargreaves, Paul Ellis and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Management Techniques”.
Aims to clarify some of the problems of forecasting for managers of small and medium-sized businesses, thereby achieving control through forecasts. An investment policy is a plan for the future, and as such it needs to be both simple and effective.

results.title: Investigators: Divorce special
results.creator_credit: Catherine Shirley and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This special edition of “The Investigators” looks at how two people can disentangle their lives when their marriage grinds to a halt. It is a consumer guide on how to ease the pain and loss of separation and includes useful hints on how to make a divorce less painful, if not more amicable.

results.title: Investigation of rape
results.brief_description: A training film for police and medical personnel which shows the procedures which they should follow in the investigation of rape. For women, an informative, educational film about an investigative procedure that they may have perceived with as much fear and apprehension as an attack itself.

results.title: Investigating hibernation: the golden-mantled ground squirrel
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the underlying mechanism of hibernation and the concept of biological clocks. Squirrels still hibernate in the alien laboratory environment. The film shows clearly the arousal-increase in pulse rate, deeper breathing, shivering and contortions and the fully awakened normal temperature state.

results.title: Invest in a casting
results.creator_credit: John Mottershaw, Alec Dalby, British Information Services and Mottershaw Commercial Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the ancient lost-wax process for making castings is still used in investment casting. Follows the stages by which the ceramic die is prepared to receive the molten metal, the careful inspection of the die and the two different methods of casting. Demonstrates the whole process of casting and gives a series of examples of articles in common use made by investment casting.

results.title: Inventors of thingumajigs
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Paul Larose and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This beautiful, humorous and mad film introduces us to a very special breed of people whose rarefied ideas suffer occasional setbacks. Whatever the invention - comb-cleaner, panty-hose, snowmobile - these “inventors of thingumajigs” are a valuable natural resource who contribute much to society.

results.title: Invasion of the boneseed plants
results.creator_credit: Peter Nagels and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Looks at the boneseed plant, a noxious weed that threatens native flora and fauna and is spreading at an alarming rate. Narrated by Tony Evans.

results.title: Introduction to work sampling
results.creator_credit: Oscar Patterson and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Points out that single or unsystematical observations may give quite erroneous ideas of how efficiently a worker is employed. Explains the “random” concept in statistics, using a bowl of 10,000 marbles of two colors. Applies the random sample method to a model of a machinist’s working day. Presents the claim that work sampling can provide many results of stop-watch time-and-motion study: standard hours of production work; average performance index; indication of idle time and delay causes.

results.title: Introduction to the performing arts: opera with Henry Butler
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander, Robert Saudek, Learning Corporation of America and Robert Saudek Associates
results.brief_description: Henry Butler, stage director for the New York Metropolitan Opera Company, comments on the emotional inspiration for opera, famous opera houses, and trends in opera today. Includes interviews with the performers, and long extracts from performances of La Traviata and I Pagliacci.
